channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lower branches restricting vision to traffic, 8th October
item.description:
Lower branches prevent the view of traffic coming towards the junction as you look left from Cherry Tree Walk into Eden Park Avenue
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian direction sign pointing in wrong direction, 8th October
item.description:
The sign photographed needs rotating approximately 90 degrees clockwise so that it points in the correct direction

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51, Greenwich Church Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Supermarket trolley and traffic cones, 8th October
item.description:
There is a supermarket trolley, on the pavement as you turn into Pickford Road via Avenue Road. Also several cones jotted out into Avenue Road also a metal long obstruction left by the bus stop( the first stop after bexleyheath station bus stop) going up avenue road from Station towards the Broadway opposite where the road says closed and lots of cones that will end up in Avenue Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickford Lane, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The fence which is at the back of 18 School Crescent which backs onto Mill Place open space is damaged as some of the panels are wobbly from the high winds which requires repairing, 8th October
item.description:
The fence which is at the back of 18 School Crescent which backs onto Mill Place open space is damaged as some of the panels are wobbly from the high winds which requires repairing- it is a concern about dogs being walked in this area being injured by this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Iron Mill Lane, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter bin not emptied often enough and being raided by foxes, 8th October
item.description:
This litter bin is currently overflowing and is not emptied often enough. The litter bins on Green Dale are not fit for purpose as they are frequently raided by foxes who tip the contents out over the pavement. Please can you replace the litter bins with anti-fox models?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Dale, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet
